core.status.redactedResponse.description: A minimal representation of Kibana's operational status.

level.description: Service status levels as human and machine readable values.

core.status.response.description: Kibana's operational status as well as a detailed breakdown of plugin statuses indication of various loads (like event loop utilization and network traffic) at time of request.

collection_interval_in_millis.description: The interval at which metrics should be collected.

elasticsearch_client.description: Current network metrics of Kibana's Elasticsearch client.

totalActiveSockets.description: Count of network sockets currently in use.

totalIdleSockets.description: Count of network sockets currently idle.

totalQueuedRequests.description: Count of requests not yet assigned to sockets.

detail.description: Human readable detail of the service status.

documentationUrl.description: A URL to further documentation regarding this service.

level.description: Service status levels as human and machine readable values.

meta.description: An unstructured set of extra metadata about this service.

summary.description: A human readable summary of the service status.

level.description: Service status levels as human and machine readable values.

meta.description: An unstructured set of extra metadata about this service.

summary.description: A human readable summary of the service status.

plugins.description: A dynamic mapping of plugin ID to plugin status.

uuid.description: Unique, generated Kibana instance UUID. This UUID should persist even if the Kibana process restarts.

build_date.description: The date and time of this build.

build_flavor.description: The build flavour determines configuration and behavior of Kibana. On premise users will almost always run the "traditional" flavour, while other flavours are reserved for Elastic-specific use cases.

build_hash.description: A unique hash value representing the git commit of this Kibana build.

build_number.description: A monotonically increasing number, each subsequent build will have a higher number.

build_snapshot.description: Whether this build is a snapshot build.
